alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Greene; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 4:08PM CDT until July 29 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cocke County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Greene County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 508 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Parrottsville to near Newport to 11 miles northwest of Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Newport, Parrottsville, Caney Branch, Del Rio, Cedar Creek, Round Mountain, Cosby, Hartford, Max Patch and Waterville. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 437 and 451. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
